text:
Nothing too new to add, but ours also depends on the individual writer/editor.

Typically writers align with managing editors on what the focus should be for a given period of time, but the individual writers take the lead on actually handling their own schedule and workload. Weekly one-on-ones (and other, more frequent touchpoints) help make sure things stay on track.

Obviously, like others have said, newer/more junior writers typically have their cal done for them by an editor until they get their feet wet.

text: Would just like to say that I'm dealing with something similar and I found these responses to be helpful starting points!
